JobFullDesc:
Slack is searching for a Director of Video and Film to lead campaign-based video work and oversee a talented team of video producers, animators and vendors who work on a variety of projects ranging from educational GIFs, customer stories, and events. 
 
As the first position of its kind at Slack, you will have a wealth of opportunity for growth and the opportunity to create change. This multifaceted role combines your expertise for orchestrating full-funnel campaigns, your passion for mentoring people, and a keen eye for video excellence.
 
The Director of Video reports directly to the Director of Creative and will be responsible for overseeing all video work developed internally and by external partners. You are a champion of creative excellence, motivating a talented team to concept and execute award-winning work that is thoughtful, strategic, and meticulously crafted. You are flexible, gracious, and can solve any problem through ingenuity, empathy, and unflappable professionalism. 
 
 
At Slack, our mission is to make people’s working lives simpler, more pleasant, and more productive. We live by this, and improving people’s working life starts with our own company. We’re building a platform and products we believe in — as well as a strong, diverse team of curious, creative people who want to do the best work of their lives and support each other in the process. Why not say hello?
 
What you will be doing:

Mentor, manage and lead the video team
Build highly-conceptual campaigns from storyboard development through execution
Provide actionable creative direction that leads to exceptional, conceptual work
Partner closely with the Director of Creative on all projects
Partner closely with the Head of Brand and Creative on high-visibility projects
Address and action on CEO-level feedback and requests  
Build a team of video and animation experts and shape the team to bolster our production capabilities
Onboard and manage agencies and vendors to build out a best-in-class team
Occasionally roll up your sleeves and make the work 
Approach requests, projects, and with a holistic view of the business
Foster a culture of trust, collaboration, transparency, and creative excellence

 
What you should have:

6+ years management experience
Experienced creative thinker with a deep film background. You value creative quality; for yourself and for others while meeting company goals and aligning initiatives.
Experience with global campaigns, live action and animation projects. Familiarity with script writing is a bonus
Strong understanding in all aspects of the filmmaking process
Adaptability and agility to provide thoughtful input when projects change, timelines shift, or scopes vary. You have a strong knowledge of how to navigate change and the ability to help your team to mitigate issues as they arise
Excellent time and project management skills
You are a dedicated and enthusiastic communicator and collaborator.
You actively invite feedback and give thoughtful, specific, and timely feedback
Ability to clearly articulate ideas and film concepts 
Outstanding interpersonal skills; ability to build strong relationships with cross-functional team members and lead through influence
Passion for helping make people’s working lives simpler, more pleasant, and more productive. 
Prior in-house Enterprise/SaS experience is a bonus

 
Slack is registered as an employer in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Slack is registered, you will not be eligible for employment.Visa sponsorship may not be available in certain remote locations.Visa sponsorship is not available for candidates living outside the country of this position.
 
 
Slack is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Slack will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
